title: Why has Jenny Ryan returned to X Factor: Celebrity?
text:
Jenny Ryan is returning to The X Factor: Celebrity despite being eliminated (Picture: Rex Shutterstock/ITV)

The Chase’s Jenny Ryan is set to get her shot at X Factor stardom after she was put through to the live shows as a late addition.

Viewers saw the 37-year-old rejected by Overs mentor Nicole Scherzinger on Saturday night’s show – causing outrage among those watching as she was told she had not made it to the next stage.

Except now she has after all – and she’ll no doubt be talking about it when she appears on This Morning on Monday.

But why has she returned to the show?

Here’s what you need to know…

Why has Jenny Ryan returned to X Factor: Celebrity?

Jenny was reinstated to the show – and given a spot in the live shows – after Nicole Scherzinger admitted she had changed her mind about her original decision.

Jenny was originally rejected from the Overs category by mentor Nicole Scherzinger (Picture: ITV)

Jenny was just brilliant at her audition in LA. That voice of hers is one of a kind, and she’s an amazing person to get to know,’ Nicole explained. ‘So it was such a tough decision to make.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘After a lot of discussion we all agreed we had to put her through. The Overs are gonna smash it this year!’

Meanwhile Jenny said she was ‘delighted’ to be given the chance to take part in the live shows.

‘The response from the public has been overwhelming – what an incredible experience. I’m so pleased it’s continuing!’ she added.

What did Jenny Ryan sing at her X Factor: Celebrity audition?

The TV star – better known as The Chase’s Vixen – showed a different side of herself when she belted out the Queen classic Somebody To Love at her audition on the show.

She won herself a standing ovation from the judges, with Louis telling her: ‘Wow Jenny, where did all that come from? You’ve got a great voice.’

Meanwhile Nicole Scherzinger added: ‘Jenny, you were like, “I don’t really care y’all…Welcome to my back garden.”

‘To know that you’re like a human encyclopaedia or whatever – when you opened your face hole and that came out, I was like, “Yeah!”’

The viewers agreed, with many tipping her to win the series at that point.

Prior to her performance she said: ‘When I was asked to come on the show I thought, “Wow, what an opportunity,” I love singing with my little ukulele and I thought, “Let’s see what Simon thinks”.’

This Morning is on Monday on ITV from 10.30am.

X Factor: Celebrity’s first live show is on Saturday night on ITV from 8.20pm.

description: Jenny Ryan will compete in the X Factor: Celebrity Live shows despite not being put through - but just what happened?
